item.title: Why Netlify?
item.description: Why Netlify? fitvids('.shareagain', {players: 'iframe'}); Activity TIME: ‚è± 10 minutes Go to this repo: https://github.com/apreshill/iyo-apero Click on the ‚ÄúDeploy to Netlify‚Äù button üöÄ Clone GitHub repo We just created: a full blogdown project‚Ä¶ containing a Hugo site‚Ä¶ deployed to Netlify‚Ä¶ in a remote repository on YOUR GitHub (i.e., https://github.com/<you>/iyo-apero; you may have changed the repo name after clicking on the ‚ÄúDeploy to Netlify‚Äù button).

item.title: Why Hugo?
item.description: Why Hugo? fitvids('.shareagain', {players: 'iframe'}); Activity TIME: ‚è± 10 minutes Let‚Äôs use this time to configure your new Hugo site. Site configuration Edit your config.toml file. This is your basic Hugo site configuration file. It is not quite YAML- it is written in TOML, which means we have key = value instead of key: value pairs.

item.title: Why Hugo Ap√©ro?
item.description: Why Hugo Ap√©ro? fitvids('.shareagain', {players: 'iframe'}); Activity TIME: ‚è± 10 minutes Let‚Äôs get started customizing your home and ‚Äúabout‚Äù pages. Make your home page Open up content/_index.md and edit the frontmatter only. It is important that you keep this file name. In Hugo, the home page is special- it gets special treatment. You can read more here: https://gohugo.

item.title: Why blogdown?
item.description: Why blogdown? fitvids('.shareagain', {players: 'iframe'}); Activity TIME: ‚è± 10 minutes Choose your own adventure! You may: Run through the blogdown checks, following: https://alison.rbind.io/post/2020-12-27-blogdown-checks/
